entry.title: SAP MaxAttention Summit 2026: Shaping the Future of Enterprise Innovation
entry.content:
We‚Äôre thrilled to announce the SAP MaxAttention Summit 2026 in Heidelberg, Germany, taking place on March 24‚Äì26, 2026. This exclusive, in-person event brings together visionary leaders and technology innovators from the SAP MaxAttention community to explore the next level of enterprise evolution.

This year‚Äôs Summit will spotlight:

  • Agentic AI to provide predictive analytics and contextual recommendations unlocking new levels of efficiency and decision-making
  • SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Business Technology Platform to empower your organization with real-time insights and scalable innovation
  • The integrated toolchain to enable faster execution by aligning enterprise-wide processes and supporting end-to-end orchestration
  • A clean core approach to ensure your system architecture and processes remain lean for faster innovation cycles and sustainable system evolution
  • Success Plans to streamline your innovation journey by offering a simplified, outcome-driven services portfolio

Expect compelling keynotes from SAP executives, immersive customer experience sessions, and deep-dive expert discussions. The Summit offers curated networking opportunities‚ÄØand one-on-one meetings with senior SAP leadership ‚Äì designed to help you accelerate your business priorities.

Watch the recap video from the last Summit to get inspired and save the date to join us in Heidelberg for an unforgettable experience.

Event location (Heidelberg Congress Center)

The Heidelberg Congress Center (HCC) embodies modernity and sophistication as an innovative event venue. Located next to Heidelberg‚Äôs main station, it offers excellent transport connections and easy accessibility. Situated in the vibrant Bahnstadt district, the HCC is surrounded by a wide range of hotels ‚Äì including the ATLANTIC Hotel ‚Äì and remains just a short distance from the historic old town, with its charming accommodations and diverse restaurants.

Welcome reception (Tuesday, March 24, Restaurant & Bar 15 High, ATLANTIC Hotel)

The Restaurant & Bar 15 High rooftop bar at the ATLANTIC Hotel Heidelberg is an exceptional venue to connect with your peers and to grow your network. It provides a panoramic city view while you can enjoy a high-class atmosphere and unique dining experience.

Evening event (Wednesday, March 25, Heidelberg Castle)

Heidelberg Castle offers an unforgettable setting for an evening event. As one of Germany‚Äôs most famous landmarks, it represents the city‚Äôs rich history and cultural heritage. Perched high above Heidelberg, the castle‚Äôs panoramic terrace provides stunning views over the old town and the surrounding hills. Its blend of historic grandeur and romantic charm creates an inspiring atmosphere ‚Äì perfect for networking, celebrating, and memorable experiences.

entry.title: Reimagining Logistics for the Cloud Era ‚Äî Inside SAP Logistics Management
entry.content:
Many small and mid-sized companies still depend on siloed systems: an old WMS here, spreadsheets for transportation, and emails for carrier updates. The result? Disconnected visibility, inefficiency, and rising logistics cost.

SAP Logistics Management (LGM) reimagines this landscape.
Built natively on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), LGM unifies warehousing, transportation, and network collaboration into a single intelligent cloud platform. It brings the power of SAP EWM, SAP TM, and SAP Business Network for Logistics (BN4L) together for the first time in a cloud-native experience.

Solution Overview ‚Äî Unified, Scalable, and Built for the Cloud

SAP Logistics Management bridges execution gaps by bringing every logistics function into a unified flow: from goods receipt to shipment confirmation, across multiple warehouses, modes, and carriers.

Source: 4577_SAP_Logistics_Management_L2_Public

Key Design Principles

Principle Description
Cloud-nativeSaaS architecture, auto-updates, minimal IT footprint.
Unified logistics layerIntegrates warehouse, transport, and carrier collaboration.
AI-enabledEmbedded Joule AI assistant supports planning and exception handling.
Network-readyPre-integrated with SAP Business Network for Logistics.
Composable & scalableAdopt modules progressively (start small, scale fast).

Functional Scope ‚Äî From Warehouse to Network

SAP LGM delivers four main functional pillars:

  1. Warehouse Logistics (cloud EWM capabilities)

  2. Transportation Logistics (cloud TM capabilities)

  3. Network Collaboration (integrated with BN4L)

  4. Unified Planning & Control (real-time visibility cockpit)

Each pillar comes with its own set of Fiori apps, use cases, and business value.

Warehouse Logistics ‚Äî Cloud EWM Simplified

Warehouse Logistics in LGM handles end-to-end inbound, internal, and outbound warehouse operations. Designed for ease of adoption, it provides structured receiving, storage, and dispatch processes with mobile execution and embedded analytics ‚Äî all running in the cloud.

Category Capabilities Business Benefit

InboundGoods receipt, putaway, inspectionReduce manual errors and waiting time.
InternalBin management, replenishmentOptimize space and movement.
OutboundPicking, packing, staging, loadingFaster fulfillment accuracy.
MobileScanning & task confirmationReal-time execution; paperless workflow.
MonitoringDashboards & alertsImprove supervisory visibility.

Warehouse Monitor App: Imagine a retailer‚Äôs regional warehouse receiving 200 SKUs per day. The supervisor uses Warehouse Monitor to see that Putaway Zone B is overloaded while Zone C is idle. Within seconds, tasks are rebalanced to maintain service levels ‚Äî no need for spreadsheets.

Key Fiori Apps in Warehouse Logistics

App Name Usage
Warehouse MonitorSupervisors track workload, resources, exceptions.
Execute Warehouse TasksOperators perform putaway/picking with handhelds.
Manage Inbound DeliveriesCreate, monitor, and post receipts for inbound deliveries.

Transportation Logistics ‚Äî Intelligent Freight Orchestration

Transportation Logistics in LGM brings planning, tendering, execution, and freight costing into one intelligent workflow. It eliminates spreadsheet-based planning and manual RFQs by integrating real-time carrier collaboration.

Category Capabilities Business Benefit
PlanningLoad building, route optimisation & consolidationCut freight costs and carbon footprint.
TenderingPeer-to-peer / broadcast to carriersAutomate carrier selection.
ExecutionFreight order tracking & event managementAchieve end-to-end visibility.
CostingFreight cost calculation & invoice reconciliationImprove financial accuracy.
AppointmentDock scheduling & time windowsReduce waiting time and idle assets.

Manage Freight RFQs App: A chemical manufacturer planning an urgent dispatch to Delhi creates an RFQ in LGM. Three carriers receive tenders instantly via BN4L; within minutes, Carrier A accepts with best price and lead time ‚Äî no emails or phone calls needed.

Key Fiori Apps in Transportation Logistics

App Name Usage
Manage Freight RFQsCreate/manage carrier RFQs.
Tender Freight OrdersPublish freight offers to carriers.
Track Freight OrdersView live shipment events & status.

Network Collaboration ‚Äî Connected by Design

Network Collaboration within SAP LGM links shippers and carriers digitally via the SAP Business Network for Logistics. It replaces emails and calls with structured collaboration ‚Äî carrier tenders, dock appointments, shipment events, and POD uploads all happen in one network workspace.

Category Capabilities Business Benefit
Carrier CollaborationTender acceptance / status updatesFaster onboarding, less manual follow-up.
Appointment SchedulingDock slot managementSmoother inbound/outbound flow.
Tracking & EventsMilestones & delay alertsPredictive visibility.
DocumentationProof of Delivery / Freight invoice sharingPaperless compliance.

Manage Carrier Collaboration App: A transport partner accepts a freight order from the shipper and uploads the signed POD once delivery is complete. The system automatically updates LGM and triggers freight invoice posting in ERP.

Key Fiori Apps in Network Collaboration

App Name Usage
Manage Carrier CollaborationDigital tender acceptance & status updates.
Schedule Dock AppointmentsDock slot coordination with carriers.
Monitor Shipment MilestonesTrack shipment events and POD status.

Unified Planning & Control ‚Äî Visibility in One View

Narrative
The Unified Planning & Control cockpit serves as the command centre for logistics execution. It integrates data from warehousing, transportation, and network collaboration into one consolidated dashboard, allowing real-time monitoring and decision-making.

Feature Description
Unified Planning ConsoleAggregate view of all logistics plans & statuses.
Control TowerMonitors execution progress and exceptions.
KPI DashboardsVisualises service levels and throughput.
Exception HandlingGuided workflows to resolve delays and errors.

Logistics Dashboard App: A distribution manager opens the dashboard each morning to view all facilities on one screen. If a lane‚Äôs OTD drops below 95 %, he drills into that carrier and sends an RFQ for replacement service ‚Äî action taken within minutes, not days.

Key Fiori Apps in Unified Planning & Control

App Name Usage
Logistics DashboardKPI overview of logistics network.
Exception Management HubCentralised issue tracking & resolution.
Dashboard for PlanningCompare planned vs actual performance.

Integration ‚Äî Seamless by Default

LGM connects to SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Network using standard APIs and content packages. Data flows bi-directionally for deliveries, goods movements, freight costs and invoices. This ensures a single source of truth across finance and operations.

Intelligence Layer ‚Äî Joule AI for Smarter Decisions

Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI copilot, is built into LGM. It understands context, answers in natural language, and automates common decisions like carrier selection or route replanning.

Source: 4577_SAP_Logistics_Management_L2_Public

A planner types, ‚ÄúWhich deliveries are at risk today?‚Äù Joule returns a list of orders facing delays and suggests rescheduling or alternate carriers based on historic performance. The planner approves in one click ‚Äî no manual analysis

Business Benefits ‚Äî Tangible Value for Growing Companies

Area Impact
SpeedGuided cloud deployment reduces implementation time by 50 %.
VisibilityUnified planning console gives end-to-end control.
EfficiencyAI and automation reduce manual coordination effort.
ScalabilityStart with one site or process, expand as needed.
Continuous InnovationQuarterly updates add new features without upgrades.

#SAP #SAPLogisticsManagement #SAPEWM #SAPTM #SAPBusinessNetwork #SupplyChain #CloudLogistics #AIinLogistics #Joule

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Your Must-Attend Sessions on SAP BTP
entry.content:
It feels like I came back from SAP Connect just yesterday, but SAP TechEd is now less than two weeks away. In addition to the virtual event, SAP TechEd 2025 will be held in five different cities and offer hundreds of sessions. Here‚Äôs my guide to the must-attend sessions for AI agents, SAP Business Technology Platform architecture, Extensions, and Integration across the world, as well as Virtual.

 

Why SAP TechEd 2025 is Unmissable

The enterprise technology landscape is evolving at breakneck speed, and SAP TechEd 2025 promises to be the defining moment where cutting-edge innovation meets hands-on expertise. This is the leading event for developers and IT professionals ready to explore SAP's most transformative technologies and emerge with skills that deliver measurable impact from day one.

SAP TechEd

  • SAP TechEd Berlin (November 4-6, 2025) offers the flagship in-person experience where you'll connect directly with SAP experts, participate in hands-on workshops, and build lasting professional relationships within the global SAP community
  • SAP TechEd Virtual (November 4-6, 2025) provides the same high-quality technical content online for free for maximum accessibility, allowing you to explore the latest innovations in application development, integration, data, and AI from anywhere in the world

SAP TechEd on Tour

The SAP TechEd on Tour series delivers localized, immersive experiences tailored to regional technical communities. Each event combines the core SAP TechEd experience with region-specific insights, local expert networks, and formats optimized for different technical communities and career advancement goals.

  • ASUG Tech Connect in Louisville, KY (November 4-6) focuses on practical skills for North American practitioners
  • Mastering SAP in Sydney, Australia (November 12-14) brings together Asia-Pacific technical experts for intensive learning and networking
  • SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore, India (November 25-26) offers hands-on workshops and certification boot camps designed for the thriving Indian developer community
  • DSAG TechXchange 2026 in Hamburg, Germany (March 19) provides specialized DevOps-focused sessions for European technical professionals

 

Must-Attend Sessions at SAP TechEd 2025

Don't miss these carefully curated sessions that will give you the deepest insights into SAP's technology roadmap and hands-on skills you can immediately apply. Here are my top recommendations for SAP TechEd Berlin, Virtual, and ASUG Tech Connect, organized by city and focus area:

SAP TechEd Berlin & Virtual

üèóÔ∏è Platform Strategy & Architecture

  • ST126 | Understanding our strategy for SAP BTP: The big picture: Get the executive overview of SAP's unified platform strategy directly from the Head of BTP Product Management. This is essential for understanding how all SAP technologies connect. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • XP100 | Accelerate adoption of SAP Business Technology Platform with confidence: Learn practical implementation approaches using SAP's Architecture Center and Discovery Center resources. Perfect for planning your BTP adoption strategy. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

ü§ñ AI & AI Agents

  • AD202 | Orchestrating enterprise automation with custom AI agents: Build custom AI agents from scratch in Joule Studio and integrate them with SAP Build Process Automation. Features real customer use cases from Uniper Energy
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • AI102 | Boosting business efficiency with AI innovations in document processing: Discover how SAP Document AI automates structured and unstructured document processing with cutting-edge AI technologies. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • IN200 | Empower your agents to be responsible: Understand AI agent governance and security through SAP Integration Suite's API Management capabilities.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

üíª Application Development & Automation

  • AD820 | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions: Get exclusive previews of upcoming SAP Build enhancements including Joule copilot integration and improved developer productivity tools. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • AD104 | Boost your ABAP development with SAP Joule for Developers: Learn how AI is transforming ABAP development with SAP Joule, from code acceleration to custom AI scenario development.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation: Get hands-on experience combining SAP Integration Suite with SAP Build and SAP Signavio solutions. Learn to create automation-based integrations powered by AI capabilities and prebuilt content to drive process innovation.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN

 üîó Integration

  • IN100 | Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite: Essential for anyone migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite. Covers tools, best practices, and technical challenges with real-world insights. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

üîí Security & Compliance

  • XP802 | Road map for security and compliance services in SAP BTP: Stay ahead of security requirements with upcoming BTP security features, identity management, and compliance enhancements. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

 

ASUG Tech Connect - Louisville, KY

üèóÔ∏è Platform Strategy & Architecture

  • Introduction to SAP Business Technology Platform: Get a complete overview of SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to explore the full potential of the platform. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Hands-on Lab: Accelerate adoption of SAP Business Technology Platform with confidence: Gain hands-on experience in accelerating your adoption of SAP BTP with SAP Discovery Center, a single point of entry for BTP and Business AI knowledge assets. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

ü§ñAI & AI Agents

  • AI-Powered Document Automation: Accelerate SAP Processes with Confidence: We will share real-world examples of global companies using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to streamline document processing, improve data accuracy, and achieve measurable results in a matter of weeks. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Hands-on Lab: Build Your Own AI Solution with the Generative AI Hub: Get hands-on experience building a custom AI solution with the generative AI hub capability in AI Foundation. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Hands-on Lab: Get Hands-on Experience to Extend Joule and Build AI Agents: Get hands-on experience with Joule Studio to extend Joule technology with custom skills and build AI agents. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Extend Joule with Custom Skills and Custom Agents for SAP Cloud ERP: Get maximum value from the Joule copilot in SAP Cloud ERP by extending it with custom-built skills and intelligent agents that can plan, act, and execute tasks. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW          

 üíª Application Development & Automation

  • SAP Build: Latest Innovations and Road Map: Explore the strategic road map for the SAP Build portfolio and see how recent and upcoming innovations in low-code and pro-code tools are transforming application development, process automation, and business site design. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Introduction to Application Development and Automation: Learn how the key capabilities, recent innovations, and road map for SAP‚Äôs application development and automation solutions enable you to build, extend, and automate apps quickly. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 üîó Integration

  • Introduction to Integration: Harness AI to Future-Proof Your Integration Investment: Essential for anyone migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite. Covers tools, best practices, and technical challenges with real-world insights. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • ASUG Community Conversations- SAP Integration in SAP Business Technology Platform: Connect with SAP experts and the ASUG Community as they share their experiences, solutions, and strategies. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Innovations, Investments, and Future Road Map for SAP Integration Suite: Explore recent innovations across API management, event-driven architecture, B2B integration, hybrid deployment models, and AI-driven automation. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 üîí Security & Compliance

  • Explore Security Services with SAP BTP: Explore the extensive capabilities of SAP BTP in security, identity, and access management. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 

Register. Attend. Reap Results.

The sessions above represent hours of curated content distilled into the most impactful learning opportunities to deliver technical knowledge at SAP TechEd 2025. You'll get architecture frameworks, implementation strategies, and direct access to the platform's subject matter experts. Whether you're migrating integrations, deploying AI agents, or hardening security, these sessions answer your actual questions. And of course, you can't miss the keynotes at SAP TechEd to explore how SAP's newest technologies and capabilities will bring in results:

SAP TechEd - Berlin & Virtual

  • KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next: Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt to these changing roles. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

entry.title: Leveraging Web Client Procedures for Use of LLMs within HDLRE
entry.content:
Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing data management systems with their advanced semantic understanding and exceptional generalization capabilities. In this article we will explain how to leverage existing web client procedure support in SAP HANA Cloud, data lake Relational Engine (HDLRE) to integrate LLMs. With this feature, customers can now harness the power of LLMs for enhanced database management and analytics. 

 SAP AI Core, a service within the SAP Business Technology Platform, is designed to manage the execution and operations of AI assets in a standardized and scalable manner. While this article primarily focuses on SAP AI Core as the LLM service, please note that the feature is highly adaptable and can be integrated with any LLM service that best meets your requirements. 

 To deploy an LLM model within SAP AI Core, follow the instructions provided at‚ÄØinitial setup for SAP AI core service‚ÄØto enable the service, generate a service key, and obtain an access token. Subsequently, you can deploy a language model, such as GPT-5 or Cloud Sonnet 4, and retrieve the deployment URL. Detailed instructions for this process are available at‚ÄØcreate deployment for generative AI model in SAP AI core.‚ÄØ 

 In HDLRE, you can create a user-defined web client procedure to make HTTP requests to an HTTP server. This procedure will be used to invoke LLM services. For a more detailed explanation, please refer to the‚ÄØdocumentation to create a procedure (web service).‚ÄØ 

 In our example, we have developed a web client procedure named AIPOST to make AI API calls. Ensure that the API version is specified according to the relevant AI API documentation. 

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE AIPOST ( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ data LONG VARCHAR 

) 

RESULT(c1 long varchar, c2 long varchar)‚ÄØ 

URL ‚Äò$YOUR_DEPLOYMENT_URL/chat/completions?$API_VERSION' 

TYPE 'HTTP:POST:application/json' 

HEADER 'Authorization:Bearer $YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' 

SET 'HTTP(VERSION=1.1)';

To call the procedure for an introduction to SAP HDLRE, use the following example: 

CALL AIPOST('{ "messages": [ { "role": "user", "content": "What is SAP HDLRE" } ] }');

 Building on this, more advanced and practical stored procedures can be developed to leverage LLMs effectively. For instance, if we have an expense table, with some potentially suspicious round numbers( for testing), ‚ÄØ‚ÄØwe can employ AI to detect any irregular data patterns that may indicate potential fraud. In this procedure, we will gather all data from the expense table and submit it, along with a query, to the LLM service. 

Please be advised that the stored procedure sp_parse_json will be available in HDLRE version QRC4/2025. 

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE ask_ai_fraud_detection( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IN user_question LONG VARCHAR 

) 

BEGIN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _payload LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE @expense_data LONG VARCHAR DEFAULT ''; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _response LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE @clean_question LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IF user_question LIKE '%detection%' OR user_question LIKE '%fraud%' THEN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM SYSTABLE WHERE table_name = 'expense' AND table_type = 'BASE') THEN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT 'All Expense Records: ' +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØLIST('ID:' + CAST(ISNULL(expense_id, 0) AS VARCHAR) +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Desc:' + ISNULL(expense_description, 'N/A') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Amount:' + CAST(ISNULL(amount, 0) AS VARCHAR) +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Date:' + CAST(ISNULL(expense_date, TODAY()) AS VARCHAR) +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Category:' + ISNULL(category, 'N/A'),‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ' || ') 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ INTO @expense_data 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM ( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT expense_id, expense_description, amount, expense_date, category 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM expense 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ORDER BY expense_date DESC 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ) AS recent_expenses; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ELSE 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET @expense_data = 'Expense table not found in database'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ END IF; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ END IF; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Clean the user question for JSON (escape quotes and newlines) 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET @clean_question = REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ user_question + ' [Database Context: ' + @expense_data + ']', 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '"', '\\"'), CHAR(10), '\\n'), CHAR(13), '\\r'), CHAR(9), '\\t'); 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Build complete JSON payload directly 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET _payload = '{"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"' + @clean_question + '"}]}'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT c2 INTO _response 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM (AIPOST(@json_payload)) 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ WHERE c1 LIKE '%Body%'; 

   

   -- Parse the JSON and extract the content 

   CALL sp_parse_json('ai_parsed', _response); 

 

   -- Display the response 
   SELECT ai_parsed.choices[[1]].[message].[content]; 

END; 

 

call ask_ai_fraud_detection('Can you detect any fraud in the expenses table, apply Benford law if needed');

Once the response is parsed from its JSON format, we obtain the analysis from the LLM service. Initially, it explains Benford‚Äôs law, and then identifies the dataset as suspicious, and offers recommendations. 

Here is another example of leveraging AI to redact sensitive personal data and generate an alternative treatment plan for patients. Similar to the previous example, this stored procedure retrieves data from the patient_records table and sends it to the LLM service. 

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE ask_ai_redact( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IN user_question LONG VARCHAR 

) 

BEGIN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _payload LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _data LONG VARCHAR DEFAULT ''; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _response LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE @clean_question LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Get medical data from the specified table 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM SYSTABLE WHERE table_name = 'patient_records' AND table_type = 'BASE') THEN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Build medical data string with all patient information 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØSELECT 'Medical Records Data: ' +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØLIST('Record_' + CAST(record_id AS VARCHAR) +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Name:' + ISNULL(patient_name, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|DOB:' + ISNULL(CAST(birth_date AS VARCHAR), 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Gender:' + ISNULL(gender, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Phone:' + ISNULL(phone_number, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Email:' + ISNULL(email_address, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Address:' + ISNULL(street_address, '') + ', ' + ISNULL(city_name, '') + ', ' + ISNULL(province_code, '') + ' ' + ISNULL(postal_code, '') + 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|SIN:' + ISNULL(sin, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|OHIP:' + ISNULL(ohip_number, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Diagnosis:' + ISNULL(CAST(diagnosis_description AS VARCHAR(100)), 'Unknown') + 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Treatment:' + ISNULL(CAST(treatment_notes AS VARCHAR(100)), 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Doctor:' + ISNULL(doctor_name, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|VisitDate:' + ISNULL(CAST(visit_date AS VARCHAR), 'Unknown') + 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ' || ') 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ INTO _data 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM ( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT * FROM patient_records ORDER BY record_id 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ) AS sample_records; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ELSE 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET _data = 'No medical records table found'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ END IF; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Clean the user question for JSON (escape quotes and newlines) 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET @clean_question = REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ user_question + ' [Database Context: ' + _data + ']', 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '"', '\\"'), CHAR(10), '\\n'), CHAR(13), '\\r'), CHAR(9), '\\t'); 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Build complete JSON payload directly 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET _payload = '{"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"' + @clean_question + '"}]}'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT c2 INTO _response 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM (AIPOST(@json_payload)) 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ WHERE c1 LIKE '%Body%'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ  

    -- Parse the JSON and extract the content  

   CALL sp_parse_json('ai_parsed', _response); 

 

   -- Display the response 
   SELECT ai_parsed.choices[[1]].[message].[content]; 
 

END; 

 

call ask_ai_redact('Replace sensitive personal data with placeholder values like [REDACTED_NAME]. Return the redacted data in the same format. Also provide an alternative treatment plan for each patient.');

The response confirms that all sensitive data has been redacted, and a recommended treatment plan is provided. 

Additionally, we can develop auxiliary stored procedures to simulate context windows, preserving chat history like chat-based AI models like ChatGPT. We can also create procedures that leverage LLMs for data usage predictions, schema analysis, and more. This feature allows us to fully capitalize on the immense potential of both the database and the LLMs. We hope you find this feature valuable and enjoy the numerous opportunities it brings for enhanced database management and analytics!
